text:
Dara Ó Briain (; born 4 February 1972) is an Irish comedian and television presenter. He is best known for hosting panel shows such as "The Panel" (2003–2011), "Mock the Week" (2005–present), ' (2012–present) and ' (2006–present). He has also been on "Don't Feed the Gondolas" (1997–2001), "Three Men in a Boat" (2006–2011), "Have I Got News for You" (1990–present), "QI" (2003–present), "Stargazing Live" (2011–present), "Dara Ó Briain's Science Club" (2012–2013) and "School of Hard Sums" (2012–2014).
Ó Briain was born in Bray, County Wicklow. He has two children with his wife, Susan, a surgeon. They live in London, England.

annotations.surface_form: Have I Got News for You
